div.p: SAFFI, or Asfi, a seaport on the west coast of Morocco, in 32° 20'N. 9° 12' W., 106 m. W.N.W. of Marrãkesh. (Pop. about 15,000.) Although the principal wool and grain port of central Morocco, the anchorage is an open roadstead and communication with the shore is at times difficult. The old palace with

p.p: transformed from HTML to TEI by eb-html2tei
beautifully decorated courts in fair repair, built by Mohammed XVII., is a prominent object above the town, and there are many interesting buildings and ruins.
